meta.title: Gski ReviewLoop API Reference
meta.subtitle: Designing content and information architecture for an API Reference in AWS style.
meta.teaser: API documentation samples with endpoint descriptions, request/response examples, and error handling guidance. Written for developer audiences with varying familiarity levels.

project.summary: Gski ReviewLoop provides collaboration primitives for creative tools. You can create threads pinned to a location in a file, add comments, and resolve threads. Use webhooks to receive events when review activity occurs.

section.heading: About This Sample
section.body:
About This Sample

Gski ReviewLoop is not a real service. It's a fictional stand-in representing similar API documentation I created at AWS for products including AWS Marketplace and AWS Partner Central.

The documentation structure, endpoint patterns, and technical writing approaches shown here reflect real work, adapted into a fictional context to protect proprietary information.

section.heading: Endpoint
section.body:
The endpoint is specific to your Region.

reviewloop.{region}.gski.example

section.heading: Authentication and authorization
section.body:
You must sign requests with Gski Signature V4 and include the signature in the Authorization header.

If you use one of the Gski SDKs, requests are signed for you.

Actions
  • CreateThread
  • CreateComment
  • ResolveThread

section.heading: CreateThread
section.body:
Creates a review thread on the specified file. You can pin the thread to an anchor such as an image region, a video region at a timestamp, an audio time range, or a document text range.

Request Syntax

POST /v1/files/{fileId}/threads HTTP/1.1
Host: reviewloop.{region}.gski.example
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: CL4-HMAC-SHA256 Credential=CLAKIA.../{date}/{region}/reviewloop/cl4_request, SignedHeaders=..., Signature=...
X-Cl-Date: 20350419T184211Z

{
  "title": "string",
  "body": "string",
  "priority": "string",
  "assigneeUserId": "string",
  "mentions": ["string"],
  "anchor": { ... }
}

URI Request Parameters

The request uses the following URI parameters.

fileId
The identifier of the file in your system.
Type: String
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 128.
Pattern: ^[A-Za-z0-9._\\-]+$
Required: Yes

Request Body

For information about the parameters that are common to all actions, see Common Parameters.

Note: In the following list, the required parameters are described first.
title
A short summary visible in the review UI.
Type: String
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 120.
Required: Yes
body
A description of the feedback.
Type: String
Length Constraints: Maximum length of 5000.
Required: No
priority
The priority of the thread.
Type: String
Valid Values: low | medium | high
Required: No
assigneeUserId
The user to assign the thread to.
Type: String
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 64.
Pattern: ^usr_[A-Za-z0-9]+$
Required: No
mentions
A list of users to mention in the thread.
Type: Array of String
Array Members: Maximum number of 50 items.
Required: No
anchor
The location in the file to pin the thread to.
Type: Anchor object
Required: No

Anchor object

Provide exactly one of the following anchor shapes.

ImageRegionAnchor

{
  "type": "image_region",
  "rect": { "x": 120, "y": 80, "width": 300, "height": 180 },
  "canvas": { "width": 2048, "height": 2048 }
}

VideoRegionAnchor

{
  "type": "video_region",
  "timecodeMs": 12400,
  "rect": { "x": 812, "y": 340, "width": 420, "height": 260 },
  "canvas": { "width": 1920, "height": 1080 }
}

TimeRangeAnchor

{
  "type": "time_range",
  "startMs": 61200,
  "endMs": 68400
}

TextRangeAnchor

{
  "type": "text_range",
  "startOffset": 1024,
  "endOffset": 1188
}

Anchor validation

For region anchors, rect must fit within canvas.

For time ranges, endMs must be greater than startMs.

For text ranges, offsets must be non-negative and endOffset must be greater than startOffset.

If an anchor fails validation, the service returns ValidationException.

Response Syntax

HTTP/1.1 201
Content-Type: application/json
x-cl-RequestId: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

{
  "thread": {
    "threadId": "string",
    "fileId": "string",
    "status": "string",
    "priority": "string",
    "title": "string",
    "body": "string",
    "assigneeUserId": "string",
    "createdByUserId": "string",
    "createdAt": "string",
    "updatedAt": "string",
    "mentions": ["string"],
    "anchor": { ... }
  }
}

Response Elements

If the action is successful, the service sends back an HTTP 201 response.

The service returns the following data in JSON format.

thread
The new thread.
Type: Thread object

Errors

For information about the errors that are common to all actions, see Common Errors.

AccessDeniedException
You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.
HTTP Status Code: 403
ResourceNotFoundException
The specified file was not found.
HTTP Status Code: 404
ValidationException
One or more request fields failed validation.
HTTP Status Code: 422
ThrottlingException
The request was denied due to request throttling.
HTTP Status Code: 429

Examples

Note: In the following example, the Authorization header contents ([authorization-params]) must be replaced with a Gski Signature V4 signature. You only need to sign HTTP requests if you intend to manually create them. When you use an SDK, requests are signed for you.

Sample Request

POST /v1/files/file_8f3K2/threads HTTP/1.1
Host: reviewloop.us-east-1.gski.example
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: [authorization-params]
X-Cl-Date: 20350419T184211Z

{
  "title": "Timing feels late on this motion",
  "body": "Can we shift the punch-in earlier by about 6 frames?",
  "priority": "medium",
  "assigneeUserId": "usr_29ad",
  "mentions": ["usr_29ad", "usr_91bf"],
  "anchor": {
    "type": "video_region",
    "timecodeMs": 12400,
    "rect": { "x": 812, "y": 340, "width": 420, "height": 260 },
    "canvas": { "width": 1920, "height": 1080 }
  }
}

Sample Response

HTTP/1.1 201
Content-Type: application/json
x-cl-RequestId: [request-id]

{
  "thread": {
    "threadId": "thr_01J1C7B3C8S9R4GQ1MZ0P2D8JW",
    "fileId": "file_8f3K2",
    "status": "open",
    "priority": "medium",
    "title": "Timing feels late on this motion",
    "body": "Can we shift the punch-in earlier by about 6 frames?",
    "assigneeUserId": "usr_29ad",
    "createdByUserId": "usr_91bf",
    "createdAt": "2035-04-19T18:42:11Z",
    "updatedAt": "2035-04-19T18:42:11Z",
    "mentions": ["usr_29ad", "usr_91bf"],
    "anchor": {
      "type": "video_region",
      "timecodeMs": 12400,
      "rect": { "x": 812, "y": 340, "width": 420, "height": 260 },
      "canvas": { "width": 1920, "height": 1080 }
    }
  }
}

section.heading: CreateComment
section.body:
Creates a comment in the specified thread.

Request Syntax

POST /v1/threads/{threadId}/comments HTTP/1.1
Host: reviewloop.{region}.gski.example
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "body": "string",
  "mentions": ["string"]
}

URI Request Parameters

threadId
The identifier of the thread.
Type: String
Pattern: ^thr_[A-Za-z0-9]+$
Required: Yes

Request Body

Note: In the following list, the required parameters are described first.
body
The comment text.
Type: String
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 5000.
Required: Yes
mentions
A list of users to mention in the comment.
Type: Array of String
Array Members: Maximum number of 50 items.
Required: No

Response Syntax

HTTP/1.1 201
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "comment": {
    "commentId": "string",
    "threadId": "string",
    "fileId": "string",
    "body": "string",
    "createdByUserId": "string",
    "createdAt": "string",
    "mentions": ["string"]
  }
}

Errors

For information about the errors that are common to all actions, see Common Errors.

ConflictException
The thread is resolved and your workspace does not allow comments on resolved threads.
HTTP Status Code: 409
ResourceNotFoundException
The specified thread was not found.
HTTP Status Code: 404
ValidationException
One or more request fields failed validation.
HTTP Status Code: 422

See Also

  • CreateThread
  • ResolveThread

section.heading: ResolveThread
section.body:
Marks the specified thread as resolved.

Request Syntax

POST /v1/threads/{threadId}/resolve HTTP/1.1
Host: reviewloop.{region}.gski.example
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "resolutionNote": "string"
}

URI Request Parameters

threadId
The identifier of the thread.
Type: String
Pattern: ^thr_[A-Za-z0-9]+$
Required: Yes

Request Body

resolutionNote
A note added to the resolution event.
Type: String
Length Constraints: Maximum length of 2000.
Required: No

Response Syntax

HTTP/1.1 200
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "thread": {
    "threadId": "string",
    "status": "string",
    "resolvedAt": "string",
    "resolvedByUserId": "string",
    "updatedAt": "string"
  }
}

Errors

For information about the errors that are common to all actions, see Common Errors.

ResourceNotFoundException
The specified thread was not found.
HTTP Status Code: 404
ConflictException
The thread is already resolved.
HTTP Status Code: 409
